title: MAG 109 - Nightfall-converted
text:
The Magnus Archives – MAG109 – Nightfall 
 
1 
 
MAG – 109 – Nightfall 
 
[The Magnus Archives Theme - Intro] 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Rusty Quill Presents The Magnus Archives Episode One Hundred And Nine 
Nightfall 
 
[The Magnus Archives Theme – Intro - Continues] 
 
 
(Click) 
(Gurgling, gasping noise) 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Well? 
 
TREVOR 
She said you could turn it on. Didn’t say anything ‘bout talkin’. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Look, we’re on the same side. 
 
JULIA 
If you’re telling the truth. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
I mean, I don’t know what proof I can give you. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG109 – Nightfall 
 
2 
 
 
JULIA 
Well, if you’re right about it, it won’t be long until “Officer Mustermann” over 
here is able talk again. That should be illuminating. 
 
TREVOR 
He’s almost got his lungs again, if you can call ‘em lungs. 
 
JULIA 
As long as they can push air, it’ll do. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
And if you don’t like what he has to say? 
 
JULIA 
Then this cabin is a long way away from anything can hear you. 
 
(Trevor and Julia chuckle) 
 
ARCHIVIST 
A-and if I run? 
 
TREVOR 
We’re very much hoping that you do. 
 
(Trevor and Julia chuckle) 
 

The Magnus Archives – MAG109 – Nightfall 
 
3 
 
ARCHIVIST 
I read your statement, you know. You, you don’t kill people, only monsters. 
 
TREVOR 
The line gets blurrier every day. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
What about you, Julia? Following in your dad’s footsteps? 
 
JULIA 
Hm, it’s a legacy I’ve learned to be proud of. There are people who would sell 
us all out for things you can’t even imagine. I’m happy doing what it takes to 
stop that. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Murder? 
 
JULIA 
Why not? Everything dies. You think if you walk out of this cabin you just keep 
going? Something gets you, even if it’s just time. Mostly though, life on this 
planet ends violently. It’s the most natural thing in the world, and sometimes it 
makes the world a better place. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
And when something comes for you? 
 
JULIA 

The Magnus Archives – MAG109 – Nightfall 
 
4 
 
Then I die. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Th-that doesn’t scare you? 
 
JULIA 
Every second. 
 
(Gurgling, gasping noise, someone struggling to breathe) 
 
ARCHIVIST 
C-can we keep that somewhere else? 
 
TREVOR 
I want it where I can see it. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
And when you’re satisfied that I’m not trying to harm you? 
 
TREVOR 
If you’re right about that ritual, I guess you talk to Gerard. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
You said he was dead. 
 
JULIA 
He is. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG109 – Nightfall 
 
5 
 
 
(Trevor chuckles) 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Right, so we just... wait. 
 
JULIA 
That’s the plan. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Right. 
 
(More gasping sounds) 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Perhaps, if all we can do is listen to this... regrowing itself. May I suggest a way 
to pass the time? 
 
JULIA 
Sure. You want our story? 
 
TREVOR 
Gave you folks plenty already. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
I m-mean, yes, but the situation has changed quite a bit. Last I heard you were 
dying of lung cancer. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG109 – Nightfall 
 
6 
 
 
TREVOR 
I was. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
And now? 
 
TREVOR 
I’m not. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
And that doesn’t strike you as... odd? 
 
(Another struggling breath) 
 
TREVOR 
Not much I see these days isn’t ‘odd’ somehow or other. Not going to turn my 
nose up at the one bit of it that worked out well for me. I hunt monsters; my 
lungs don’t kill me. Seems like a fair trade. Maybe God did it. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
What about you, Julia? C-care to make a statement? Maybe about, uh, how 
you met Trevor? 
 
JULIA 
Sure. Why not? It’s not like you or your tape recorder get to leave here without 
us.
